Events.text: Cao Pi dies after an illness; his son Cao Rui succeeds him as emperor of the Kingdom of Wei.
Events.html: Cao Pi dies after an illness; his son Cao Rui succeeds him as emperor of the Kingdom of Wei.

Events.text: Raymond of Poitiers is defeated and killed at the Battle of Inab by Nur ad-Din Zangi.
Events.html: Raymond of Poitiers is defeated and killed at the Battle of Inab by Nur ad-Din Zangi.

Events.text: Sverre is crowned King of Norway.
Events.html: Sverre is crowned King of Norway.

Events.text: Skanderbeg defeats an Ottoman invasion force at Torvioll.
Events.html: Skanderbeg defeats an Ottoman invasion force at Torvioll.

Events.text: Jacques Cartier is the first European to reach Prince Edward Island.
Events.html: Jacques Cartier is the first European to reach Prince Edward Island.

Events.text: The Globe Theatre in London burns to the ground.
Events.html: The Globe Theatre in London burns to the ground.

Events.text: Charles I of England defeats a Parliamentarian detachment at the Battle of Cropredy Bridge.
Events.html: Charles I of England defeats a Parliamentarian detachment at the Battle of Cropredy Bridge.

Events.text: At the Battle of Konotop the Ukrainian armies of Ivan Vyhovsky defeat the Russians led by Prince Trubetskoy.
Events.html: At the Battle of Konotop the Ukrainian armies of Ivan Vyhovsky defeat the Russians led by Prince Trubetskoy.

Events.text: First privateer battle of the American Revolutionary War fought at Turtle Gut Inlet near Cape May, New Jersey
Events.html: First privateer battle of the American Revolutionary War fought at Turtle Gut Inlet near Cape May, New Jersey

Events.text: Father Francisco Palou founds Mission San Francisco de Asís in what is now San Francisco.
Events.html: 1776 – Father Francisco Palou founds Mission San Francisco de Asís in what is now San Francisco.

Events.text: Alexander Macdonell and over five hundred Roman Catholic highlanders leave Scotland to settle in Glengarry County, Ontario.
Events.html: Alexander Macdonell and over five hundred Roman Catholic highlanders leave Scotland to settle in Glengarry County, Ontario.

Events.text: Russo-Turkish War: Admiral Dmitry Senyavin destroys the Ottoman fleet in the Battle of Athos.
Events.html: Russo-Turkish War: Admiral Dmitry Senyavin destroys the Ottoman fleet in the Battle of Athos.

Events.text: Autocephaly officially granted by the Ecumenical Patriarchate of Constantinople to the Church of Greece.
Events.html: Autocephaly officially granted by the Ecumenical Patriarchate of Constantinople to the Church of Greece.

Events.text: Ninety-nine people are killed in Canada's worst railway disaster near St-Hilaire, Quebec.
Events.html: Ninety-nine people are killed in Canada's worst railway disaster near St-Hilaire, Quebec.

Events.text: Greek politician Charilaos Trikoupis publishes a manifesto in the Athens daily Kairoi entitled "Who's to Blame?" leveling complaints against King George. Trikoupis is elected Prime Minister of Greece the next year.
Events.html: Greek politician Charilaos Trikoupis publishes a manifesto in the Athens daily Kairoi entitled "Who's to Blame?" leveling complaints against King George. Trikoupis is elected Prime Minister of Greece the next year.

Events.text: France annexes Tahiti.
Events.html: France annexes Tahiti.

Events.text: In Sudan, Muhammad Ahmad declares himself to be the Mahdi, the messianic redeemer of Islam.
Events.html: In Sudan, Muhammad Ahmad declares himself to be the Mahdi, the messianic redeemer of Islam.

Events.text: George Edward Gouraud records Handel's Israel in Egypt onto a phonograph cylinder, thought for many years to be the oldest known recording of music.
Events.html: George Edward Gouraud records Handel's Israel in Egypt onto a phonograph cylinder, thought for many years to be the oldest known recording of music.

Events.text: Hyde Park and several other Illinois townships vote to be annexed by Chicago, forming the largest United States city in area and second largest in population.
Events.html: Hyde Park and several other Illinois townships vote to be annexed by Chicago, forming the largest United States city in area and second largest in population.

links.title: Hyde Park Township, Cook County, Illinois

Events.text: Doukhobors burn their weapons as a protest against conscription by the Tsarist Russian government.
Events.html: Doukhobors burn their weapons as a protest against conscription by the Tsarist Russian government.

Events.text: The North Saskatchewan River flood of 1915 is the worst flood in Edmonton history.
Events.html: The North Saskatchewan River flood of 1915 is the worst flood in Edmonton history.

Events.text: British diplomat turned Irish nationalist Roger Casement is sentenced to death for his part in the Easter Rising.
Events.html: British diplomat turned Irish nationalist Roger Casement is sentenced to death for his part in the Easter Rising.

Events.text: France grants 1 km² at Vimy Ridge "freely, and for all time, to the Government of Canada, the free use of the land exempt from all taxes".
Events.html: France grants 1 km² at Vimy Ridge "freely, and for all time, to the Government of Canada, the free use of the land exempt from all taxes".

Events.text: Arthur Meighen returns to office as Prime Minister of Canada.
Events.html: Arthur Meighen returns to office as Prime Minister of Canada.

Events.text: The Bird of Paradise, a U.S. Army Air Corps Fokker tri-motor, completes the first transpacific flight, from the mainland United States to Hawaii.
Events.html: The Bird of Paradise, a U.S. Army Air Corps Fokker tri-motor, completes the first transpacific flight, from the mainland United States to Hawaii.

Events.text: First test of Wallace Turnbull's controllable-pitch propeller.
Events.html: 1927 – First test of Wallace Turnbull's controllable-pitch propeller.

Events.text: The Outerbridge Crossing and Goethals Bridge in Staten Island, New York are both opened.
Events.html: The Outerbridge Crossing and Goethals Bridge in Staten Island, New York are both opened.

Events.text: Carpathian Ruthenia is annexed by the Soviet Union.
Events.html: Carpathian Ruthenia is annexed by the Soviet Union.

Events.text: The Federal Aid Highway Act of 1956 is signed, officially creating the United States Interstate Highway System.
Events.html: The Federal Aid Highway Act of 1956 is signed, officially creating the United States Interstate Highway System.

Events.text: The United States Supreme Court rules in the case Furman v. Georgia that arbitrary and inconsistent imposition of the death penalty violates the Eighth and Fourteenth Amendments, and constitutes cruel and unusual punishment.
Events.html: The United States Supreme Court rules in the case Furman v. Georgia that arbitrary and inconsistent imposition of the death penalty violates the Eighth and Fourteenth Amendments, and constitutes cruel and unusual punishment.

links.title: Eighth Amendment to the United States Constitution
Fourteenth Amendment to the United States Constitution

Events.text: Isabel Perón is sworn in as the first female President of Argentina. Her husband, President Juan Perón, had delegated responsibility due to weak health and died two days later.
Events.html: Isabel Perón is sworn in as the first female President of Argentina. Her husband, President Juan Perón, had delegated responsibility due to weak health and died two days later.

Events.text: Mikhail Baryshnikov defects from the Soviet Union to Canada while on tour with the Kirov Ballet.
Events.html: 1974 – Mikhail Baryshnikov defects from the Soviet Union to Canada while on tour with the Kirov Ballet.

Events.text: Steve Wozniak tested his first prototype of Apple I computer.
Events.html: Steve Wozniak tested his first prototype of Apple I computer.

Events.text: The Seychelles become independent from the United Kingdom.
Events.html: The Seychelles become independent from the United Kingdom.

Events.text: The Conference of Communist and Workers Parties of Europe convenes in East Berlin
Events.html: 1976 – The Conference of Communist and Workers Parties of Europe convenes in East Berlin

links.title: 1976 Conference of Communist and Workers Parties of Europe

Events.text: Space Shuttle program: STS-71 Mission (Atlantis) docks with the Russian space station Mir for the first time.
Events.html: Space Shuttle program: STS-71 Mission (Atlantis) docks with the Russian space station Mir for the first time.

Events.text: The Sampoong Department Store collapses in the Seocho District of Seoul, South Korea, killing 501 and injuring 937.
Events.html: 1995 – The Sampoong Department Store collapses in the Seocho District of Seoul, South Korea, killing 501 and injuring 937.

Events.text: Naval clashes between South Korea and North Korea lead to the death of six South Korean sailors and sinking of a North Korean vessel.
Events.html: Naval clashes between South Korea and North Korea lead to the death of six South Korean sailors and sinking of a North Korean vessel.

Events.text: Hamdan v. Rumsfeld: The U.S. Supreme Court rules that President George W. Bush's plan to try Guantanamo Bay detainees in military tribunals violates U.S. and international law.
Events.html: Hamdan v. Rumsfeld: The U.S. Supreme Court rules that President George W. Bush's plan to try Guantanamo Bay detainees in military tribunals violates U.S. and international law.

Events.text: Apple Inc. releases its first mobile phone, the iPhone.
Events.html: Apple Inc. releases its first mobile phone, the iPhone.

Events.text: A derecho sweeps across the eastern United States, leaving at least 22 people dead and millions without power.
Events.html: A derecho sweeps across the eastern United States, leaving at least 22 people dead and millions without power.

Events.text: The Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant self-declared its caliphate in Syria and northern Iraq.
Events.html: The Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant self-declared its caliphate in Syria and northern Iraq.
